column4: i get this error when the live ubuntu installer copying files to hard disk {errno 5} input/output error  ---- i have checked the cd and it was verified aready and the iso passed the hash test...this is a new sata hard drive..windows xp 64 installed working good in the past?
luigi: you probably should do a recovery bootup and try to the options there
that's not a healthy error, i'd considered re-trying the install after you re-prepare the target free space and or partition.
this is my 6 time trying the install
something isn't right..
is the cd drive clean 'n healthy?
is the partition clean and healthy

that was what i was thinking...but i tried different cds and different partition....i tried booting up with puppy linux that works fine.....but yeah im thinking it might be the drive.....i wanted to install iso on usb drive and boot from there but
do you get a consistant i/o error?
mostly ltl had other times like kubuntu where it just froze after awhile
i'm using a junky pIII hp notebook and no ubuntu would install, i grabbed debian disk 1 iso and all rocked outa the box
could it be the size of my sata drive 320gb i had no problem installing to my 160gb in the past
one of mine is a 250gb sata, no problems using ubuntu since ubuntu version 1 whatever that was.
size should'nt be an issue, i'd suggest booting a gparted cd and clean that drive up.
i googled that and got quite a few hits, looks like a bug.
oh
yah that what he means, is the cd drive clean
i never cleaned it.....i think that is the problem...i guess i should buy one of those cd/dvd drive cleaners at best buy or radio shack....?
md5sum the iso to see if it's non-corrupt.
i did already its not that
clean is good.
